relation: Creation Station Little Explorers Suitable for 1-5 years. 10.30am - 11.30am
Life on the Edge: Ice Age Frontier

Traces of Empire: Decoration and Design in Roman Britain In 43 AD, Britain was invaded and became a province of the Roman Empire. However trade, population movement and political alliances meant links had been forged before the invasion. This new display looks at the change in decoration and style during this period using significant archaeological finds from Museums Sheffield’s collections.
